alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Conecuh; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe, northeastern Clarke, Wilcox and north central Conecuh Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms scattered from 9 miles east of Camden to near Pine Hill to 11 miles northwest of Monroeville. These storms were moving very little. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Thomasville, Camden, Grove Hill, Peterman, Whatley, Pine Hill, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Yellow Bluff and Pine Apple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
